title: Empowering Charities Harnessing Data for lmpactful Automation, Analytics, and Visualisation | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: Learn to leverage data analytics for strategic planning, risk management, and leadership, driving growth, sustainability, and positive change in charity organisations.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Empowering Charities Harnessing Data for lmpactful Automation, Analytics, and Visualisation
Empowering Charities Harnessing Data for lmpactful Automation, Analytics, and Visualisation
Learn to leverage data analytics for strategic planning, risk management, and leadership, driving growth, sustainability, and positive change in charity organisations.
Leadership and Communication, Business Management, Data Science and Analytics, Risk Management

In today’s dynamic landscape, leveraging data analytics and technological innovation is crucial for the growth and sustainability of charity organisations. Skilled professionals are key to driving impactful operations.

This course addresses strategic risks identified in the charity sector's Enterprise Risk Management survey, notably the rise of succession planning and key man vulnerabilities, from 52% in 2016 to 85% in 2023. It equips charity professionals with essential knowledge in strategic planning, risk management, human resources, and leadership, empowering them to leverage data analytics to mitigate risks and ensure operational continuity and long-term sustainability.

Participating in this data analytics course for charity professionals offers invaluable career growth and sector impact. As charity organisations increasingly rely on data-driven insights to shape strategic decisions, mastering data analytics is a key competitive edge. This course also equips participants with the skills to analyse data, identify trends, and extract actionable insights, empowering them to drive positive change within their organisations. Participants will enhance their professional capabilities, positioning themselves as key assets in charity organisations and opening doors to new career opportunities and leadership roles.

This data analytics training is designed for professionals at all career levels and job functions within charity organisations. The content is also highly applicable to individuals in related sectors such as social enterprises, NGOs, and community development organisations. The target audience includes:
Entry-level staff seeking to develop foundational data analytics skills to contribute effectively to their roles.
Mid-level managers and programme coordinators interested in leveraging data-driven insights to enhance programme efficiency, decision-making, and impact assessment within charity organisations.

Senior executives, directors, and board members responsible for strategic planning, resource allocation, and organisational governance, seeking to harness data analytics for informed decision-making and sustainable growth in the charity sector.
Introduction to Robotic Process Automation (RPA) and tools
Understand RPA, its benefits for charities, and explore popular RPA tools (e.g., UiPath, Automation Anywhere) to select the right one for your organisation
Learn key data analysis techniques including data cleaning, summary statistics, correlation analysis, and identifying patterns and trends
Explore big data tools, data transformation techniques, and workflow automation for creating dynamic dashboards and business reports
Gain insights from real-world case studies and learn best practices for applying data analytics and automation in charity organisations
Associate Professor, Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Desi Arisandi is an Associate Professor of Accounting at Singapore Institute of Technology, specialising in Accounting Information Systems and Data Analytics. Holding a doctorate degree from The State University of New Jersey (USA), her expertise lies in the intersection of technology and innovation within the accounting field.

Desi's professional journey includes significant contributions to projects under the US Governmental Accounting Standards Board (GASB), focusing on automating data collection and implementing Robotic Process Automation (RPA) for enhancing accountability in local government entities. Her research interests encompass a range of cutting-edge topics, including RPA, smart contract development using blockchain technology, and predictive analytics leveraging machine learning techniques. With a strong foundation in academic rigor and practical industry experience, Desi brings a dynamic blend of skills to her role as a trainer, fostering a deeper understanding of advanced accounting methodologies and technological advancements among her students.
Assistant Professor, Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology
Assistant Professor, Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Gao Fei (Phoebe) is Assistant Professor in the Business, Design and Communication cluster at Singapore Institute of Technology. Phoebe specialises in quantitative analysis, investment and risk management and derivatives pricing, as she has strong research interests and academic trainings in statistics, risk management, asset pricing and mathematical modelling. Her research and publications include loan loss provisions and return predictability, the journey of Exchange Traded Funds, and the risks dynamics with options term structure.

Phoebe is proficient in programming languages such as Python, R, Stata, excel VBA and conducted trainings in Artificial Intelligence for Accountants and Finance Professionals using R. She was also a trainer for CFA program and was appointed as an advisor for derivatives pricing for PKF.

She holds a B.Sc. and M.Phil. in Risk Management Science (with full scholarship) from the Chinese University of Hong Kong and received her PhD in Business (Finance) from Singapore Management University. Prior to her academic journey, Phoebe worked in insurance industry and specialize in Director and Officers’ liability insurance.
Lead Professional Officer, Singapore Institute of Technology
Lead Professional Officer, Singapore Institute of Technology

Janet is a Chartered Accountant (Singapore), a Certified Tableau Desktop Specialist, and Alteryx Designer Core Certified. She graduated with an Accountancy degree from the NUS and a Masters in Instructional Technology from NTU. Over the past decade, she has been passionately teaching courses in accounting, auditing, and business analytics to both students and working professionals. In June 2024, she led a masterclass on a teaching case using data analytics tools in Atlanta, USA, organised by the American Accounting Association. Currently, Janet is an academic staff member at SIT, where she teaches and mentors undergraduates. Additionally, she took up business consultant role for firms and engages in industry research projects focused on data analytics for business.

Objective: Equip participants from charity organisations with the essential knowledge and skills to implement Robotic Process Automation (RPA) to streamline operations, improve efficiency, and maximising impact.
Learn how RPA can enhance efficiency and reduce costs for charities by automating repetitive tasks
Explore a practical RPA tool for implementing automation solutions
Gain hands-on experience creating RPA workflows for charity-specific tasks
Overview of popular RPA tools (e.g., UiPath, Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism)
Comparison of RPA tools based on features, pricing, and suitability for charities
Selecting the right RPA tool for your organisation's needs
Identifying automation opportunities within charity operations
Creating a roadmap for RPA implementation
Practical demonstration of building a basic automation workflow using a selected RPA tool
Participants follow along with step-by-step guidance
Q&A session to address specific challenges and concerns

Objective: Provide participants from charity organisations with a comprehensive understanding of data analytics and visualisation using popular and current big-data tools in the industry. The training will cover key concepts, techniques, and best practices to empower participants to leverage data effectively for decision-making and impact assessment.
Excel window and data structure discussion
Introduction to MS Excel interface and workbook organisation
Variable creation, indexing, and data types (text, date, numeric, logical)
Overview of worksheet functions for data manipulation
Explanation of time series, cross-sectional, and panel datasets
Presentation of relevant sample data for hands-on exercises
Formatting cells for different data types (text, date, numeric)     Introduction to logical functions and conditional formatting
Practical exercises on formatting and data validation
Techniques for data cleaning (removing duplicates, handling missing values)
Calculation of summary statistics (mean, median, mode, range, standard deviation, skewness, kurtosis) using Excel functions
Hands-on exercises on data cleaning and statistical calculations
Understanding the concept of correlation between variables
Calculation of correlation coefficients in Excel
Interpretation of correlation results and implications for decision-making
Identifying patterns and trends in data using MS Excel tools
Interpretation of patterns and trends in the context of charity operations
Linear models in MS Excel: interpretation, assumptions, and limitations
Introduction to linear models (regression analysis) in MS Excel
Understanding assumptions and limitations of linear models
Open floor for participants to ask questions and seek clarification
Understand data structure and variable construction
Learn various sample types, functions and formats
Understand and interpret the relationship between variables
Perform basic trend analysis and liner models

Objective: Provide participants from charity organisations with a comprehensive understanding of data analytics and visualisation using popular and current big-data tools in the industry. The training will cover key concepts, techniques, and best practices to empower participants to leverage data effectively for decision-making and impact assessment.
Introduction to big data and analytics
Understanding big data and its relevance to charity organisations
Overview of data analytics and its benefits for decision-making
Challenges and opportunities in data-driven decision-making for charities
Introduction to data visualisation and data reporting
Importance of data visualisation in conveying insights
Overview of data reporting tools and their capabilities
Data preparation techniques (data cleansing, data integration, data transformation)
Hands-on workshop: selected tool for data preparation and transformation
Benefits of workflow automation for efficiency and scalability
Business report presentation and dynamic dashboard with selected business intelligence (BI) tool
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who
Attend at least 75% of the course;
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The evaluation will consist of two multiple-choice sessions: Day 1 (30 minutes) and Day 2 (30 minutes).
The full fee for this course is S$2,180.00
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
Learn more about funding schemes available
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.

Helping SMEs Embed Sustainability in Business

Co-developed with the Association of Small & Medium Enterprises (ASME), the ‘Introduction to Sustainability for Businesses’ course provides companies with the knowledge and frameworks for mapping their sustainability goals.

Is learning new skills still relevant after 40? This was the question Resendos faced while contemplating taking up a postgraduate certificate course at SIT. His decision to constantly upskill himself shaped his entrepreneurial journey.
Business Management, Design Innovation, Career Growth and Transition
Redefining Thinking and Learning at SkillsFuture Festival

The annual SkillsFuture Festival to promote lifelong learning was hosted by the Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) this year on 23 July. Riding on the theme of ‘Design for the Future Economy’, the single-day event featured 53 learning workshops and talks, with SIT faculty staff sharing their expert insights on thinking and learning.
Design Innovation, Leadership and Communication, Health Sciences
Lifelong Learning - Upskill with SITizens Learning Credits

To grow professionally, lifelong learning is practically a must when adapting in today’s VUCA world. As a graduate from Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT), how can you make use of the resources on hand to progress in your career?
Business Management, Career Growth and Transition
Agile Orientation for Digital Transformation: Concepts, Practices and Mindsets
Master Agile methodology in this 2-day course. Gain theory, practical skills, and toolkits for real-world implementation and success
Learn mentorship fundamentals and communication skills to foster effective communication and professional growth, empowering mentees.
Green Transformation with Sustainability Excellence Associate (SEA) and B Corp Certification Process
Master sustainable business practices to boost operational performance, focusing on SEA and B Corp certifications for long-term growth and resilience.
Leadership and Communication, Business Management, Sustainability, Energy Efficiency
Machine Learning and AI Data Analytics for the Semiconductor Industry
Learn to address semiconductor manufacturing complexities with AI and ML and gain hands-on experience using Python programming.
Data Science and Analytics, AI and Machine Learning, Executive Education
Learn essential personal branding skills, overcome career stagnation and create impactful content for career advancement.
An executive programme that trains leaders in open source technology, risk management, and innovation, preparing them for Chief Open Source Officer roles.
